io.customerly

Class Customerly

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.customerly.Customerly

  • public class Customerly
extends java.lang.Object
    The singleton representing the Customerly SDK

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Customerly.Callback 
      static class  Customerly.HtmlMessage
      A class representing a SpannableStringBuilder with a method Customerly.HtmlMessage.toPlainTextString() that convert the formatted text to a plain string
      static interface  Customerly.RealTimeMessagesListener
      Implement this interface to register a listener for incoming real time chat messages with realTimeMessages(RealTimeMessagesListener).
      static interface  Customerly.SurveyListener

    • Method Detail

      • with

        @NonNull
public static Customerly with(@NonNull
                                       android.content.Context pContext)
        Call this method to obtain the reference to the Customerly SDK
        Parameters:
        pContext - A Context
        Returns:
        The Customerly SDK instance reference

      • configure

        public void configure(@NonNull
                      java.lang.String pCustomerlyAppID)
        Call this method to configure the SDK indicating the Customerly App ID before accessing it.
        Call this from your custom Application Application.onCreate()
        Parameters:
        pCustomerlyAppID - The Customerly App ID found in your Customerly console

      • configure

        public void configure(@NonNull
                      java.lang.String pCustomerlyAppID,
                      int pWidgetColor)
        Call this method to configure the SDK indicating the Customerly App ID before accessing it.
        Call this from your custom Application Application.onCreate()

        You can choose to ignore the widget_color provided by the Customerly web console for the action bar styling in support activities and use an app-local widget_color instead.
        Parameters:
        pCustomerlyAppID - The Customerly App ID found in your Customerly console
        pWidgetColor - The custom widget_color. If Color.TRANSPARENT, it will be ignored

      • setVerboseLogging

        public void setVerboseLogging(boolean pVerboseLogging)
        Call this method to enable error logging in the Console. Avoid to enable it in release app versions, the suggestion is to pass your.application.package.BuildConfig.DEBUG as parameter
        Parameters:
        pVerboseLogging - true for enable logging, please pass your.application.package.BuildConfig.DEBUG

      • update

        public void update(@Nullable
                   Customerly.Callback.Success pSuccessCallback,
                   @Nullable
                   Customerly.Callback.Failure pFailureCallback)
        Call this method to check for pending Surveys or Message for the current user.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        pSuccessCallback - To receive success async response
        pFailureCallback - To receive failure async response
        See Also:
        Customerly.Callback

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String email,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String user_id,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String name)
        Call this method to link your app user to the Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        email - The mail address of the user, this is mandatory
        user_id - The optional user_id of the user, null otherwise
        name - The optional name of the user, null otherwise

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String email,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String user_id,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String name,
                         @Nullable
                         Customerly.Callback.Success pSuccessCallback,
                         @Nullable
                         Customerly.Callback.Failure pFailureCallback)
        Call this method to link your app user to the Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        email - The mail address of the user, this is mandatory
        user_id - The optional user_id of the user, null otherwise
        name - The optional name of the user, null otherwise
        pSuccessCallback - To receive success async response
        pFailureCallback - To receive failure async response

      • registerUser

        public void registerUser(@NonNull
                         java.lang.String email,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String user_id,
                         @Nullable
                         java.lang.String name,
                         @Nullable
                         org.json.JSONObject pAttributes,
                         @Nullable
                         Customerly.Callback.Success pSuccessCallback,
                         @Nullable
                         Customerly.Callback.Failure pFailureCallback)
        Call this method to link your app user to the Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        email - The mail address of the user, this is mandatory
        user_id - The optional user_id of the user, null otherwise
        name - The optional name of the user, null otherwise
        pAttributes - Optional attributes for the user in a single depth json (the root cannot contain other JSONObject or JSONArray)
        pSuccessCallback - To receive success async response
        pFailureCallback - To receive failure async response

      • setAttributes

        public void setAttributes(@Nullable
                          org.json.JSONObject pAttributes,
                          @Nullable
                          Customerly.Callback.Success pSuccessCallback,
                          @Nullable
                          Customerly.Callback.Failure pFailureCallback)
        Call this method to add new custom attributes to the user.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        pAttributes - Optional attributes for the user in a single depth json (the root cannot contain other JSONObject or JSONArray)
        pSuccessCallback - To receive success async response
        pFailureCallback - To receive failure async response

      • openSupport

        public void openSupport(@NonNull
                        android.app.Activity activity)
        Call this method to open the Support Activity.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        activity - The current activity

      • isLastSupportConversationAvailable

        public boolean isLastSupportConversationAvailable()
        Call this method to indicate if from a previous update(Callback.Success, Callback.Failure), registerUser(String, String, String, Callback.Success, Callback.Failure) or setAttributes(JSONObject, Callback.Success, Callback.Failure) an unread message is available.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Returns:
        If an unread message is available

      • openLastSupportConversation

        public void openLastSupportConversation(@NonNull
                                        android.app.Activity activity)
        Call this method to open directly the Chat Activity if an unread message is available.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        activity - The current activity

      • logoutUser

        public void logoutUser()
        Call this method to close the user's Customerly session.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)

      • trackEvent

        public void trackEvent(@NonNull
                       java.lang.String pEventName)
        Call this method to keep track of custom labelled events.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        pEventName - The event custom label

      • isSurveyAvailable

        public boolean isSurveyAvailable()
        Call this method to indicate if from a previous update(Callback.Success, Callback.Failure), registerUser(String, String, String, Callback.Success, Callback.Failure) or setAttributes(JSONObject, Callback.Success, Callback.Failure) a survey is available.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Returns:
        If a survey is available

      • openSurvey

        public void openSurvey(@NonNull
                       android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm)
        Call this method to start a survey in a DialogFragment, if available.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        fm - The SupportFragmentManager to show the DialogFragment

      • openSurvey

        public void openSurvey(@NonNull
                       android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm,
                       @Nullable
                       Customerly.SurveyListener.OnShow pSurveyShowListener)
        Call this method to start a survey in a DialogFragment, if available.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        fm - The SupportFragmentManager to show the DialogFragment
        pSurveyShowListener - If a survey is actually displayed this callback will be invoked

      • openSurvey

        public void openSurvey(@NonNull
                       android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm,
                       @Nullable
                       Customerly.SurveyListener.OnDismiss pSurveyDismissListener)
        Call this method to start a survey in a DialogFragment, if available.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        fm - The SupportFragmentManager to show the DialogFragment
        pSurveyDismissListener - This callback will be invoked when the Survey Dialog will be dismissed.

      • openSurvey

        public void openSurvey(@NonNull
                       android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fm,
                       @Nullable
                       Customerly.SurveyListener.OnShow pSurveyShowListener,
                       @Nullable
                       Customerly.SurveyListener.OnDismiss pSurveyDismissListener)
        Call this method to start a survey in a DialogFragment, if available.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
        Parameters:
        fm - The SupportFragmentManager to show the DialogFragment
        pSurveyShowListener - If a survey is actually displayed this callback will be invoked
        pSurveyDismissListener - This callback will be invoked when the Survey Dialog will be dismissed.

        public void realTimeMessages(@Nullable
                             Customerly.RealTimeMessagesListener pRealTimeMessagesListener)
        Call this method to register a callback for incoming real time chat messages when no support activities are displayed.

        You have to configure the Customerly SDK before using this method with configure(String)
